com.google.enterprise.adaptor.prebuilt

Class RegexFilter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.enterprise.adaptor.prebuilt.RegexFilter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MetadataTransform

    public class RegexFilter
extends Object
implements MetadataTransform
    Transform that makes a MetadataTransform.TransmissionDecision, based on a document's Metadata properties. The document metadata key used to make the transmission decision are defined by "key" configuration entry. If the config has pattern that is a regular expression, then whether any values of the key metadata property matches the regular expression is determined. If pattern is not set, then whether any key named key is present determines the match. The key when determines whether the decision is made for matching documents (if that key is set to found) or made for non-matching documents (if that key is set to not-found). The config key keyset may be set to metadata or to params to restrict the search to Metadata or params, respectively. If keyset is not specified, it defaults to metadata. Most keys/values of interest will normally be specified in the document's Metadata, but some key/values of interest (e.g. ContentType, DocId) exist in the document's params.

    Example: skip documents that have a NoIndex metadata key or params key, regardless of value: 

    
 metadata.transform.pipeline=regexFilter
 metadata.transform.pipeline.regexFilter.factoryMethod=com.google.enterprise.adaptor.prebuilt.RegexFilter.create
 metadata.transform.pipeline.regexFilter.key=NoIndex
 metadata.transform.pipeline.regexFilter.decision=do-not-index

    Example: drop the content of documents that have a ContentLength greater than or equal to 100 megabytes: 

    
 metadata.transform.pipeline=regexFilter
 metadata.transform.pipeline.regexFilter.factoryMethod=com.google.enterprise.adaptor.prebuilt.RegexFilter.create
 metadata.transform.pipeline.regexFilter.key=ContentLength
 metadata.transform.pipeline.regexFilter.keyset=params
 metadata.transform.pipeline.regexFilter.pattern=0*[1-9][0-9]{8,}
 metadata.transform.pipeline.regexFilter.decision=do-not-index-content

    Example: skips documents whose Metadata Classification property is neither PUBLIC nor DECLASSIFIED: 

    
 metadata.transform.pipeline=regexFilter
 metadata.transform.pipeline.regexFilter.factoryMethod=com.google.enterprise.adaptor.prebuilt.RegexFilter.create
 metadata.transform.pipeline.regexFilter.key=Classification
 metadata.transform.pipeline.regexFilter.keyset=metadata
 metadata.transform.pipeline.regexFilter.pattern=(PUBLIC)|(DECLASSIFIED)
 metadata.transform.pipeline.regexFilter.when=not-found
 metadata.transform.pipeline.regexFilter.decision=do-not-index
    Since:
    4.1.4

    • Method Detail

      • transform

        public void transform(Metadata metadata,
                      Map<String,String> params)
        Conditionally adds a Transmission-Decision entry to the params Map. The decision is based on settings of the key, pattern, decideOnMatch, decision, and keyset configuration variables (as discussed above).
        Specified by:
        transform in interface MetadataTransform
        Parameters:
        metadata - of document
        params - are extra contextual information
